natural problem: Let $f(x)=x+5$ and let $g(x)=x^2+1$. Let $p(x)=g(x)+f(x)$ and let $q(x)=g(x)-f(x)$. Find $p(x)\cdot q(x)$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and f g p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = x + 5"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. g x = x powr 2 + 1"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. p x = g x + f x"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. q x = g x - f x"
shows  "p x * q x = x powr 4 + x powr 2 - 10 * x - 24"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $f(x)=x+5$ and let $g(x)=x^2+1$. Let $p(x)=g(x)+f(x)$ and let $q(x)=g(x)-f(x)$. Find $p(x)\cdot q(x)$. The final Answer is x^4+x^2-10x-24
 ### Proof
 We know $p(x)=(x^2+1)+(x+5)=x^2+x+6$. Also, $q(x)=(x^2+1)-(x+5)=x^2-x-4$.
 We want to find $p(x)\cdot q(x)$, so we substitute: \begin{align} p(x)\cdot q(x)&=(x^2+x+6)(x^2-x-4)\\ &=x^2(x^2-x-4)+x(x^2-x-4)+6(x^2-x-4)\\ &=x^4-x^3-4x^2+x^3-x^2-4x+6x^2-6x-24\\ &=x^4+(-1+1)x^3+(-4-1+6)x^2+(-4-6)x-24\\
 &=\boxed{x^4+x^2-10x-24}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and f g p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = x + 5"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. g x = x powr 2 + 1"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. p x = g x + f x"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. q x = g x - f x"
shows  "p x * q x = x powr 4 + x powr 2 - 10 * x - 24"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Given the functions $f(x) = x + 5$, $g(x) = x^2 + 1$, $p(x) = g(x) + f(x)$, and $q(x) = g(x) - f(x)$, find the product $p(x)q(x)$. The final answer is $x^4 + x^2 - 10x - 24$.
